item.title: Kubernetes Chaos Tools: man-o-war
item.description: Kubernetes Chaos Tools: man-o-war Kubernetes has maintained a position in the spotlight of cloud infrastructure ever since Google donated it to the CNCF in 2015. In a search to strengthen the robustness of my personal Kubernetes clusters I experiment on, I looked for an open-source suite of chaos engineering tools. Gremlin is a firm founded by some of the engineers at Netflix who originally coined the term ‘chaos engineering’, and their product certainly has the most complete set of features, but in terms of open-source projects there were four major options to consider:
